page.title: 06 LOCH OF LIFF FARM
page.content: This area contains mainly farmland although there is a small patch of woodland.This woodland is mainly deciduous with some conifers and belongs to a wood called Backmuir Wood. Loch of Liff Farm is mainly a crop growing farm although it sometimes winters cattle and sheep.The crops grown are mainly potatoes, flax, turnips, barley and oats.The land around the farm is suitable for growing fruit but this is not done because of its altitude. At the extreme North end of this block, set just back from the A923 Dundee-Coupar Angus Trunk Road there are small farms. These grow mainly soft fruits such as raspberries and strawberries.
